intro: Geniostoma tinifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
